Reviews.Title: “Great beach and location, but outdated...”
Reviews.Author: Leese_T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this hotel in a 2nd floor room. It is located in Kihei, which is close to the airport and a short drive to downtown Lahaina and nearby attractions. We read a number of reveiws from tripadvisor, and overall had a not so good impression about the hotel, but reviews did say this was one of the best beaches. While the hotel is outdated and needs some love, the staff was extraordinarily friendly and the beach truly is one of the best on Maui!! You can't beat the price for this hotel ($100.ngt), and really, how much time do you spend in a room?? It was clean and comfortable, definately not 5 star, but they did have a microwave, coffee maker and tv with good channels. We did not run into any problems with towels as was suggested with other reviews. An afforable hotel for those not expecting luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: alex5891
Reviews.Content: This place wasnt bad for the price we stayed for (91.00$ a night) but I wouldnt want to pay much more for it. The rooms were clean but TINY. IT was a struggle to find a place to put to carry-on size suitcases. The rooms are a little outdated as well. The bathroom was realllly outdated and not kept up well. There was no counterspace in the bathroom (never knew where to put my stuff in there). The shower was super small. It could be a cozy place for couples who have been to Maui before ( I wouldnt reccomend it for a honeymoon), I personally enjoy staying at the resorts better. I had to go to maui last minute and that why we stayed here. Resorts just offer a all around better hawaiin feel. This place also did not have a pool, which was a huge bummer to me. IT is however located right on the beach which was nice. Some of the front desk staff was beyond helpful and others were not.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Tugger_12
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews, they are accurate. Terrible staff at front couter, horrible rooms, smallest we have ever stayed in and ants everywhere. Dark, dingy and horrible room. Stayed 1 night and found somewhere else immediately. Maui Coast down the road is fantastic. Staff and rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but needs more TLC to justify $200 per night”
Reviews.Author: Katie O
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before the trip to Hana. The check-in staff was very friendly and offered us a choice of two rooms. The location is fantastic, a little out of the hustle of Kehei proper and right on a beautiful strip of beach. The hotel is hemmed in on one side by a large resort that has posted privacy signs along their property. In contrast, the Days Inn has a sign welcoming the public and encouraging folks to relax in their beach chairs. I appreciate that. However, the room had a sour odor. In the morning I found a cockroach crawling out of the bedding. I might be able to forgive this if I had paid $100 a night, but I paid $200 a night for this room. We were happy to go.

Reviews.Title: “You all who give negative reviews on Days Inn Maui Oceanfront are expecting too much!”
Reviews.Author: CandE_8
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Got to check in a little early (2pm). We're given room 205, upstairs partial oceanview . Room was clean, a/c cold, bed wonderful. What more can you ask for for around$100-$200/night property was quiet, beach was awesome. Very well manicured landscaping. The savings alone allowed us to do the things we really wanted to do on the island. Trust me when I tell you I have stayed in many nice 5 star properties and for the value this place can't be beat. Liken it to like the first place you and your significant other went when you first started traveling and you wanted a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable with perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Reddevils73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we wanted to be on the beach. The hotel is a fair way from the main strip of Kihei but with a car it takes a few minutes to be back into the main area. There is ample parking but I would recommend using the over flow car park as the one near the restaurant is very tight to get in and out of! It gets busy around sunset. The accommodation is basic and small, and we found the air con unit was a bit noisy. But to be fair for what we paid, this was adequate. Service was great and we used wifi in the reception. It you want something simple and to be 1 minute from the beach this is perfect. There's no bath just a shower and not much room inside. The corridors are a tad dark and you can forget which block you are in as they look the same but we found they kept the room clean and gardens pretty. In Maui you are hardly ever in the room so this is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: Liz T
Reviews.Content: This location is not for couples or families that are looking to spend a lot of time in their room but works for those that are just looking for a place to shower and sleep. PROS: Great Beach & Sunset Access Cable & Vanity Ceiling Fan Free Parking This spot neighbors the Mana Kai which has a great little restaurant called the Five Palms (good service & food) an AMAZINGLY honest and friendly activities coordinator and a general store. It's also within walking distance of many nice little restaurants and the launch dock for many of the water adventure tours. CONS: Very small showers that don't appear to have been maintained WIFI is only available in the lobby NOT in the rooms! Low count bedding Parking is scarce and once the oceanfront restaurant on the property opens, well you might have to defend your parking space! Ceiling fans are little wobbly and make noise Overall, if we were planning another trip to Maui and planned to spend all of our money on food and snorkeling again, we would stay at this location once more!

Reviews.Title: “We used to love this place!”
Reviews.Author: bombero-redbridge
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have stayed here for 5 years straight for our annual Hawaii vacation. This visit will be our last. The place is still clean & the staff is friendly and nice, but it is going downhill fast. The owners of the hotel declared bankruptcy last August of 2011. Proper upkeep & maintenance is not being completed. Our air conditioner was noisy & barely functioned. The ceiling fan speed switch was broken & stuck on low. The microwave was dead.The in-room wifi internet is no longer available. Wifi internet is in the front desk lobby only! Other guests we knew were experiencing similar issues with their rooms. Sad considering you can't beat the beach & the location.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it”
Reviews.Author: Davarua
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here in Jan. 2012. Our expectations were not high given the relatively modest prices here. However, things were worse than anticipated. Extremely small rooms, in very poor repair. Water dripping from air conditioner, broken window slats, hole burned through lamp shade, loose ceiling fan, etc. The place was clean, just falling apart. We were moved to a new room while the air conditioner was repaired, and the new room was even worse. We later moved back to the original room. During the moving process I was acosted by a cockroach as big as my foot. Given all this, the staff was friendly and helpful. They tried hard to make things right, they just didn't have much to work with. The problems appear to stem from management. All that aside, the location of the hotel is quite good - on the quiet south side of Kihei, very near upscale Wailea. Best of all, is the absolutely wonderful beach at the hotels' doorstep. Despite this, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: TravelerBoiseID
Reviews.Content: Great location, right on one of the best beaches in Maui. But that's were the charm ends. The rooms are extremely small and noisy, but clean. OK if you are not spending any time in your room. After a 2 week stay in Lahaina, we had a late flight out. We checked out of our condo, and spent the rest of the day here before leaving Maui. It served it's purpose for a nice day on the beach, and to shower and change before our flight, but we wouldn't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and Noisy but Clean”
Reviews.Author: ugogurl
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be very clean, and quite basic, and probably fine for a day or two, but I certainly wouldn't have wanted to stay for a week or more. The value was good for the price, and there were a few unexpected amenities (like a microwave and safe). The problems we had were with the noise - the AC was really noisy so we couldn't use it, the bathroom fan was almost unbearably noisy, when we opened the window there was quite a bit of noise from the restaurant next door. I've stayed at noisier places in big cities in Europe, etc., but I found it a bit irritating in Hawaii when I was looking for a nice peaceful beach experience. The beach behind the hotel was lovely. There was free parking but the spots were really tiny, and there was free wifi at the front desk. There were also beach towels at the front desk but they admitted that they often run out so that you need to get your towel for the day by 9 am.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were wanting”
Reviews.Author: jillntom
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that we had spent the prior 6 nights at the Hyatt Regency on Ka'anapali Beach & the resort was wonderful BUT we were almost always on the go, on the beach, or in the water so we didn't really get to enjoy the resort. The week prior to that we were on the Norweigan Cruise of the Islands & my husband caught a respiratory virus the day before we boarded & was under the weather for a good portion of our trip... We wanted to extend our stay last minute & we decided we didn't need anything fancy. We just wanted a decent location on the beach to sleep & shower that was clean. I would give the beach 5 stars. The sand here seemed "softer" somehow. I don't even generally like sand. There was a reef for snorkeling right out front which was great. The walk from our room to the beach at the Days Inn was about the same distance we had to walk at the Hyatt from the elevator to our room. This was really nice. You could be on the beach in 15 seconds & there is a convenient beach shower on your way back to your room to rinse yourself & gear off. A few of the parking spots are reserved for the restaurant (Sarento's) that is also on the property. It didn't fit in our plans but if we have the opportunity to return we would probably eat there. It has good ratings but is expensive. Kind of funny that it is right there with the Days Inn. The parking can be difficult at night (we always found something) but I suspect that after the restaurant closes you would have less of a problem. If all else fails you could probably park at the public beach access lot between the Days Inn & the Mana Kai Resort (not positive about this at night though). Definitely if you are on the oceanfront building you might be bothered by the restaurant patrons-- esp on the first floor. I think the second floor of the oceanfront building might be better but you still might be bothered by the restaurant patrons/noise. Just something to keep in mind. Our room did have the memory foam mattress which was comfortable. The room was small especially for us since we overpacked & accumulated a lot of stuff on our trip. I still was able to figure out where to put all of our bags (2 Large Suitcases & 2 Large Duffel Bags with a few smaller bags/backpacks). The bathroom had a shower with a handheld shower no tub. The sink vanity was very small but they did have a couple of shelves on the wall to put things. There was an in-room safe that you had to checkout the key from the front desk. I was able to put my 15.4" computer in at an angle not large by any means but I put in the most crucial stuff. There was a fridge & microwave. There was a hairdryer & coffee maker on the small vanity (no sink) outside the bathroom. The gal that checked us in was friendly. That was really the only staff member I met since my husband was the one that would trade in the beach towels & made the trips to the office. I thought the outside of the property was very well maintained as well. Two knocks I have against the place was 1. The air conditioning didn't work very well & 2. The exterior windows needed washing on our room. The Five Palms restaurant is next door at the Mana Kai Resort. We went for Happy Hour the night we arrived. It was a pretty good deal. My husband was definitely rubbed the wrong way by the first waitress/hostess he came in contact with. The next one was much friendlier. We opted to sit above b/c there was a small wait for the bar area. Our waitress was not as attentive as she should have been & we had to wait a bit but we are fairly easy going. Another party got upset about something & left. Other than the Five Palms & Sarento's those seemed to be the only restaurants on that end of the beach (at least within walking distance). Anyway, we were even willing to camp to extend our vacation 4 extra nights. If you are wanting a "resort" experience this is not the place for you. There is not a pool nor the service of a resort. If you want a clean (albeit a bit dated) place to sleep that is right on a nice beach this is a great spot. If you are used to a little higher calibur of hotel, you probably won't like this place. I, myself, pride myself in being adaptable & not too picky. We enjoyed our stay & would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of our worst experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: tcdev
Reviews.Content: I'd take all the good reviews on this place with a grain of salt. My wife & I have done a decent amount of travel; we expect to get what we pay for, and nothing more, are generally happy with our accommodation as much of it is researched on TripAdvisor, but Days Inn would have to rank as one of the worst places we've ever stayed. I won't bore you with the details of our experiences with water running into our room under the adjoining door and soaking a laptop bag and a camera bag. To be fair, that was probably a spill or wet swimming gear left by the occupants, but did nothing to endear the place to us. As others have said, small and 'cozy'. Well, that's an understatement, as I can only think of two rooms I have ever stayed in that have been smaller. You have to move the table to open the window! The room was as dark as a dungeon, and smelled the part! The bathroom fan roared like a jet engine, and the AC wasn't much better. Thankfully in December there's little need for it at night. The walls are paper thin, and our bed head was under the wooden staircase, and we heard every stomp of people going up and down day and night. It was simply unpleasant to be in, and completely unsuitable for a 'base' for a beachside holiday. You can't eat a meal in there. You can't even open a beer. This place is an overnight truck stop, and nothing more. After 3 days we couldn't wait to leave, and even considered leaving earlier! I pity the poor guys we heard checking in for an 8 night stay! The service was friendly enough, to a degree, but three things really stood out from our stay: 1. Three days stay and all 3 days they had run out of beach towels by the time we'd asked. On the 3rd day, after turning up at 10am and complaining, they finally (miraculously) "found" a couple of towels for us, and brought them down to our room. 2. They use the guest laundry to wash their own linen. With only 2 machines, we had to wait until the current load finished before we could start ours. And then we had to wait for them to finish with the drier. A whole morning wasted doing laundry. It's disgraceful. 3. This was unbelievable... the so-called 'Ocean Front' rooms - presumably with a premium - have had their courtyards reclaimed by the restaurant next door!!! So not only can you not sit outside your own room and enjoy the beach, but you have a handful of dining tables literally outside your window! And I do mean, literally outside your window. Not 2 feet from the window, which is about 3 feet from the bed!!! Until 10:30pm every night!!! No doubt seating an extra 16-20 people ordering $50 steaks makes a lot more money than wjhatever premium they charge for an 'Ocean Front'. Take my advice, ask for a room *away* from the front, as you don't get a view from your room anyway! We sat on the beach and looked at the neighbouring accommodation, green with envy. Oh, that reminds me, they chain their handful of beach chairs to the fence, so you can't move them out of the sun into the shade. Right now I'm writing this review from Kaua'i Beach Resort, which cost us the same, and is worlds away in standard. Not even close. I can say they're clean. The service is friendly enough, but that's as far as I could recommend it. Definitely could *NOT* say it was value for money. It's also on the far extremity of the 'resort stretch', so it's just a little too far to walk for dinner, and my wife & I generally do not mind walking at all.

Reviews.Title: “Best value”
Reviews.Author: Saltek
Reviews.Content: Right on the beach with two restaurants on location. The rooms are a little small and there is only Internet in the lobby but with the location you really can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but small”
Reviews.Author: Hola4876
Reviews.Content: The #1 best thing - the tempurpedic mattress & pillows - awesome! Other than that, the room was very, very small and the bathroom even tinier. The A/C barely worked which is a problem as there is not actual ventilation from the window as the hallways are pretty tight. Other reviewers were correct in that the area around the rooms is not well lit; I was not comfortable walking around by myself after dark. It is on a gorgeous beach though. The rooms were clean, the staff were very nice. For the price (~ $100), it's what you should expect on the south shore of Maui. If you want more room, expect to pay much more.

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel at good beach in S. Kehei”
Reviews.Author: Harry S
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are small but cozy and clean. No, there's no view unless you get the beach front rooms but you don't go to Maui to sit in a hotel room. See Google Earth for building layout. Building closest to the beach has 14-16 rooms. We were in 208. Mini-fridge, microwave, TV (no ports), clock-radio, & Tempur-pedic mattress that was hell on my back (sciatica). The shower had a huge crack in the floor toward the back and temperature fluctuated a bit but was otherwise fine. A vanity outside the restroom doubles as a coffee nook. AC unit is a must but noisy. Windows open for fresh air and face East for morning sun. Plantation blinds were partly broken but functional. NO INTERNET except at the office! Big long sandy beach there has public access & parking on that side is easier and there is an outdoor shower for sandy toes. Snorkeling is good there off the rocks as all along the coast. Sarento's is right next door but we didn't hear much except for some late night partiers passing through to the parking lot. No noise from Kehei rd. Close to groceries, dive shops, dining etc. We'd stay there again but please, Days Inn, fix the place up a little!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a good price.”
Reviews.Author: kurzew
Reviews.Content: We have stayed one day in Days Inn. It was the only one hotel in the area with free rooms that night. Staff was very kind and helpfull. Parking was free. Our room was small but very clean and tidy. Bathroom also. Fridge in the room was a nice bonus. I would not stay there for a long period of time but for one night was perfect. No free Wi-Fi in the room. Days Inn is situated 20 minuted walk from Kihei town center and just few minutes walk from the beach. Accesible from the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jack S
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's location and price. We knew it wouldn't be very nice, but it was worse than we expected. Tiny rooms and bathrooms. Old decor. Small stairways. No elevator. Poor lighting. Slippery sidewalks on grounds. My wife slipped and fell and I almost did many times. Tiny parking lot. Noisy AC unit. Peeling shower walls. Housekeeping did a poor job of restocking supplies. Crappy old TV. We were so disappointed we left this hotel with 4 days remaining in our 9 day stay and moved to the Maui Coast, which was divine. Of course they offered no refund for our remaining pre-paid nights. I'm sure Scott their GM will come on here and apologize and tell us how sorry he is that we didn't enjoy our stay, blah blah blah....Scott, you had a chance to make it right and you passed. Don't bother. You didn't even ask why we were leaving early. The bottom line is that although this place is cheap and on the beach, it's not worth it. Spend a little more and stay at the Maui Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: MuttToronto
Reviews.Content: It is what it is. I stayed here for a week in October. If you are looking for a resort type of holiday this is not for you. If you want a basic, affordable but clean room with a very comfortable bed on a great beach and are the type that wants to explore this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “not much of a complainer type...but better properties in the area”
Reviews.Author: travelman45
Reviews.Content: all rooms are 1 bed only....no beach chairs...only a few chained to a grassy area...thin floors...you can hear all noises above you all nite long....got tired of being kept awake half the nite....complained to management at front desk twice but nothing was ever done...dealt with it but would not stay there again....the area is very nice but truly believe better can be found....just shop around....not much to do in the immediate area...a rental car is a must here...just beware of this place and choose wisely...

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place with a Great Beach”
Reviews.Author: DJH2010
Reviews.Content: This is our second time to stay at this place. The first time we stayed there it was a Best Western. The rooms are very small but the location is great. The rooms are clean. The daily maid service is fair. If you are someone that does not spend the day in the room, it works fine. They have a nice Tempurpedic queen bed in the rooms. They have free high speed wireless internet. They have a great beach!!! For the price, it is hard to beat. We will stay there again if we go to Maui again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: fancynanc85
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is wonderful. Unfortunately, that's the only thing wonderful about Days Inn Maui Oceanfront. Although the room was clean, it was extremely small, dimly lit, and the furnishings are outdated, including the TV. The biggest problem was that there was no WiFi available except in the hotel lobby. The staff was helpful and friendly, and worked to accommodate our needs. The laundry facility doesn't have a change machine, and surrounding merchants don't want to give change. The machines should be updated to accept cards. There's no pool, but the beach area in front of the hotel is one of the nicest in Kihei. All the room sizes are the same size, with the exception of two ocean-facing double rooms. After seeing the room, I knew it would be cramped for a week's stay so I inquired about changing rooms but it was the same price as the resorts in Wailea. For my money, I'd choose the resort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic price”
Reviews.Author: jmal08
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on trip advisor and it was one of the least expensive options for my wife and myself. When we arrived I was surprised that the complex was right on the beach. The room was modest in size but very clean and had everything we needed, including a small fridge. The front desk was very helpful when I needed to send and receive a fax for some business. Overall great location, room and staff. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modest price, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TanMcK
Reviews.Content: A simple multi-unit inn, very clean, on a long, beautiful beach at the quiet end of town. Staff very hospitable. You can walk for miles on beaches and sea-side walkways, passing beautifully kept residences, parks and resort grounds. Adjacent open air restaurant (Sarento's) very pleasant for drinks, large breakfast, or fancy dinner. Deli in resort next door has drygoods, wraps & sandwiches, etc. (handy, as the inn is quite a distance south of Kihei stores). As a solo female traveler, I felt very safe. Would recommend highly for single or couple (rooms are small) on a budget who don't need the "resort" or "spa" experience. You can catch the bus just up the street (once an hour) @ $2.00 for a day pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and decent stay”
Reviews.Author: APLuvTrav
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Very close to south Kihei beaches, restaurants on kihei road and also a convenient location to other attractions in east and west maui. Cannot connect to the internet from the room. have to go to the lobby for internet access. Also no ocean view from the rooms but once you are at the parking lot you can get beautiful views of the ocean. The room was small but has all the necessary amenities including microwave and refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable...great friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda W
Reviews.Content: It was a good deal in that the motel is right on the beach. I did not have a view of the beach...but who needs a view when you're outside on the beach most of the time??? The evening receptioninst behind the front desk is very friendly and helpful. If I'm traveling by myself again and don't plan on being in my hotel very much this is a really good deal. This is a great place to stay if all you need is a place to stay for the night or a few nights. The internet access isn't very good. The rooms are small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: LUVMEXCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I chose to stay at the Maui oceanfront due to the price. Once we arrived, we found the hotel staff to be friendly. The room, however was extremely small and outdated. After the toilet overflowed and people woke us in the night partying at 2Am we chose to leave for a more quiet, spacious room at the hotel next door. This hotel is situated on a beautiful beach that has a great snorkeling reef. If budget is your main concern and you will spend all of your time outdoors then this is the place for you. If you like to stretch out and relax, like to take baths, or swim in the pool go somewhere else. Not very comfortable at all but decent for the price.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING hotel with great beds in an awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Idahocouple_05
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon on Maui and, after paying for a large wedding, we were on a strict budget. I was a little skeptical going in but the Maui Oceanfront met and exceeded all of my expectations. Here is the real deal~ The beds are SO comfy, absolutely wonderful, there is an amazing beach just in front of the hotel and is one of the only places you can stay in Kihei where you don't have to cross the main road to get to the beach. There is a big resort next door that offers concierge services if you need them and they also have a wonderful restaurant. We were not able to try Sorentos but heard great things. The rooms were clean and cozy. I was expecting them to be smaller based on all the reviews I read but they were definately sufficient. We did not spend much time in our hotel room but what time we did spend there was great. There were a few minor issues (and I mean very minor). Housekeeping was slow and a couple of days our room didn't get cleaned until 4pm but it was very clean when they did get to it. The front lobby area was very tiny but sufficient and they seem to have some drainage issues in the walkways between buildings. There was always standing water in our hallway which proved dangerous considering I almost slipped twice but I quickly figured out how to avoid it. The parking is limited but there is a lot behind the hotel that had plenty of parking and we only had to use it one night. All in all, the hotel itself is amazing! It is very cute, clean and perfect if you are on a budget and just want a nice comfortable hotel without all of the frills.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, Everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: ChadTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: The good: I stayed in room 225 which I booked through priceline for $89.00 a night. The days inn website listed the same room at $129.00 a night. Great deal. I had a partial ocean view from my corner unit. The hotel is in decent shape. Was probably updated within the last 5 years. Small comfy rooms. A/C, basic amenities, great beach front location. Free parking. Beach towels available. Charcoal BBQ grill . It's really all you need. The bad: My mattress was worn out and uncomfortable. A torn flap on the awning kept banging on my building every time the wind blew. Parking, while free is shared with the restaurant and fills up quickly after 5pm. Additional parking is available in the big unsecured public gravel lot next to the hotel. Hit or miss front desk staff. A couple of the gals we're aloof and not very helpful. A few of the others we're great. Overall: Good bang for your buck. Great location. Simple and easy.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: AlishaDallasTx
Reviews.Content: My visit which was July 25-28, 2011was disappointing. The room was small to say the least and the bed was horrible. We should have slept on the tile flooring. Room had a horrible smell and very dingy. Furniture is very outdated. Thin walls. Staff was very helpful but when we complained about the bed we were informed they were all the same. The only good thing about the hotel is the location. Right on the beach. The restaurant (Sarentos) next to it is a 5 star and pricey. They gave us a 15% off coupon to 5 Palms which was a really nice restaurant. On our next visit Maui we definitely plan on splurging and staying at a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!! The best kept secret in Maui!!”
Reviews.Author: Jean_Philippe35
Reviews.Content: Clean,comfy,great locations, if you want to bring good memories from Maui, believe me stay there!! This is THE REAL DEAL in Kihei! Manager Scott and front desk staff always there to help customers with a smile. I'm working on the road a lot so I was kind of scared at first when I read some comments about the hotel, but we didn't see any kind of problems with the room, mattress great for the back, cleaning staff are very meticulous, very friendly. I was traveling with a friend and we were amazed how the place is safe for family with childrens. I will for sure comeback at this hotel and will also for sure recommand to all my friends and business partners the Days Inn Maui oceanfront! Thank you very much! Jean-Philippe

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: Cindy1880
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for the money. Right on the beach w/ a great view. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “More like Hawaii than other hotels”
Reviews.Author: Taratree
Reviews.Content: This place was terrific! Just steps to a beautiful beach -great for swimming, walking, or just looking up and down the beach. Sunsets were beautiful. This smallish hotel is not a slick highrise ...more a throwback to a more romantic Hawaii...and no, those aren't ordinary lizards..they are friendly little geckos which are found every where in Hawaii--it's fun to watch their antics & amazing climbing skill --FYI they are completely harmless. & so what if the wifi is in the lobby...we came to swim and surf the ocean ...not the NET! We had a little suite --my mom, sister and I, which I recommend. The little living room was very tasteful...again, not slick modern, but the feeling of old Hawaii...this is what we came for! Highly recommend it...but if you need more room, get the suite.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag... bad outweighed the good unfortunately”
Reviews.Author: tjdouglas
Reviews.Content: Good value for the price, great location, room not bad. However maid service and some of the front desk (not Crystal) very much lacking. I tipped the maids the first three days of my seven day stay, but I found that each day, cleanliness of my room got worse and worse. On the fourth day, they even forgot to clean my room. When i went down to the office to tell the girl, the first thing out of her mouth was not an apology but an accusation that I left my do not disturb sign on my door all day, which I had not. Maid gave me two tiny bars of soap first day and never replenished them for the next six nights of my stay. Coffee pot and cup never rinsed out, and coffee package was never replaced or coffee area wiped down. Floor some days unswept and sheets only replaced every three days. Parking was very inconvenient as well. Overall, if you can afford something else, take it. If not, stay here, at least your in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on a great beach”
Reviews.Author: HAtraveller
Reviews.Content: Rooms quite basic, not very large. However room had fridge and safe which were useful. The hotel is practically on the beach, which is beautiful. Would highly recommend this hotel if you just want a room to sleep in but want a great beach. Need a car to get around other places as nearest shops and bars about 30-40 min walk. Staff friendly and you can use the activities booking desk in the next door hotel. Free internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: VTbrooklyn04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were island jumping and stayed at this hotel based on the location and price. We absolutely loved it! Free parking, ocean front, right by some awesome restaurants and shops. Couldn't have asked for more in an economical hotel. Only thing to know: the hotel room is VERY small. You may have 2 ft on ea. side of the bed. But really, how long are you even in the room??

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MoonwalkerSpain
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I would not stay in this hotel again. Even though the location was convenient, I think it would be willing to pay a few more dollars to stay in a hotel with a bigger bathroom. The shower was so tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Run down rooms and bugs. Enough said.”
Reviews.Author: xjgrl
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the Tempur-Pedic mattress claim. The bed may or may not have been Tempur-Pedic, but that doesn't make up for the down sides of this hotel. The room has a damp, musty smell and cockroaches were abundant! I moved the phone and inch and a lizard jumped out from underneath -- it is Hawaii, I know -- but none of my other hotels/cabins has cockroaches! The beach is negligible -- you will use the one next door at the other hotel. Sarento's next door is atrocious - do not bother dining there for any meal. Thankfully, I only had to stay here for one night. I do not usually stay at Days Inn and definitely will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: lilsnipper
Reviews.Content: this was our first trip to maui, and on a budget we chose this hotel. we were not disappointed. there were some pros and cons. we payed a little extra for an oceanfront room which was great, except for the fact our window was right where the restaurant was. i wouldn't pay and extra $30 a night again when even there regular rooms are still super close to the beach.the rooms are SUPER small but very clean. the hairdryer was from the 80's, so bring your own! we found a large amount of termites in our bathroom about half way through our 6 nights stay. the location and the beach were great! you check out towels from the front desk and its really hassle free. all and all i would stay there again because its such a good deal. just don't waste your money on an "oceanfront" room with no view. this isnt top notch, but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: msmsk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at room #107 which is a part of the unit closer to the beach. The hotel is by the beach but if you really wanna see the ocean from your room this is not the place, because it has only 2 floors and it is not high enough :). Rooms are really small but have everything needed. There was one queen bed, small nightstands, tv unit, a small bathroom and a small closet. If you don't wanna pay too much for the stay and having a decent room for sleeping is enough for you, this hotel is the right selection. The only thing that I may say is that I wish there were more hangers inside the room. The closet was tiny and it was hard to find a spot to hang the towels and clothes. The room was clean and every day the set the bed and cleaned the room. It was really good to be very close to the beach because we really liked waking up around 6 am and swimming. Kihei is also a good place, relatively cheaper than the other seasides. Maybe the only negative thing is that there was no wireless in the room even though it says "Many rooms include complimentary wireless Internet access.", Their excuse was the wireless modem was broken which I think was not true. But we were able to use the internet in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Ants+cockroaches-stay away”
Reviews.Author: ktanne007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights, It is probably one of the worst places I have ever stayed and I am pretty well travelled from hostels to 5 star hotels all over the world. I was given a room and having read a more recent review on here after I had booked it the first thing I did was pull the bed covers back when I checked in-Ants in the bed!I then looked on the floor and they were everywhere. I went back downstairs and asked if this was "normal"-I appreciate its warm weather, I was told no there shouldn't be ants and was promptly changed to another room-where again I found ants all over the floor and bathroom. Again I returned dragging my heavy case up and down the stairs again to be told to come back at 3pm. so went to beach which is lovely and right next to the hotel and at 3pm went back, take 3. still saw a couple in the corner but I was exhausted and considering I had wasted a whole day in Maui transporting luggage from room to room by myself I resided to saying it was fine. The bed was the worst bed I have ever slept in-no support whatsoever. which made getting up at 2am for the sunrise easy!sleeping on beach later would be more comfortable.Hairdryer was a waste of time-did not dry a strand of hair. Then twice I found cockroaches in the shower cubicle. old and dirty run down rooms. TV not tuned in. noisy as by a bar and thin walls-could here nextdoor every eve and morning. no do not disturb sign so maid knocked every morning. sometimes bedrooms hadn't been done until after 3pm. Then as soon as you came back to get showered they would knock! staff not very knowledgeable about activities and were not helpful in organising this. I went over to hotel nextdoor who were very helpful. They claimed to give you money vouchers with booking-which I paid extra for!appauling-15% off a very expensive restaurant next door and only entrees. parking included but fight to get a space at night as people valet park there for the restaurant. comes with a fridge which is so cold it froze everything so actually a freezer. internet not secure in half of the building. other than that its convenient for maui activities-going up the volcano and hana drive but I would never advise anyone stay there again unless you really can't afford anywhere else-I only used it as a base and was out all day seeing the sites however it wasn't even a good place to sleep as uncomfortable, ant ridden and noisy.

Reviews.Title: “The best experience of my life!!!”
Reviews.Author: basssnorkel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing!! The first night I was there, I woke up to a beautiful ocean-view from my hotel room window. That is where I spotted her- a beautiful mermaid on the beach, hanging out on a rock. I quickly ran outside to get a closer glimpse and unfortunately she got frightened (possibly by my handsome looks) and jumped back into the water and disappeared from my life. That entire day, all I can think about was her. Here I was in one of the most beautiful places in the world and I have a girl on my mind. Sure, I went snorkeling, parasailing, and cliff diving (which was a bad idea when you have that special someone in your mind- I almost jumped too short), but all I can think about was her. I went to a tiki bar that evening to get my mind off of her in hopes to meet some nice looking Polynesian women. I drank mai tais, pina coladas and even smoked a little maui wowie and all I can think about was her (I even secretly named her Ariel). I couldn't wait to go to sleep that night so I can wake up to another sighting of her. I set my alarm at 4:30am which is daybreak. The next morning, I jumped out of bed and gazed out the window. She was no where in sight- I guess she did not return, or perhaps I missed her. I ran outside and there was another man who seemed like he could have seem Ariel (he had love in his eyes and I can see the sweat on his palms). I asked him if he had seen her and he said yes (and apparently he scared her away!) I spoke to this man and evidently, he lives at this wonderful hotel and he basically lives to see her each morning through his window. He explained to me that she is very shy and the moment she hears a door open or sees a shadow of a human she returns back to her kingdom. He also explained to me that this is the only hotel that anyone has ever spotted a mermaid in the entire world. Even Tom Hanks (you know, he was in "Splash") has stayed at this hotel just to see a showing of her. He also said that she only makes an appearance once in a while and I was lucky that I spotted her the first morning there. I waited for her every day for the remainder of my stay. She never returned. I sold all of my belongings back home and am moving to Maui. I am going to live at the Days Inn just so I know she is near to me. I can't wait to see that beautiful red hair. Ariel, if you are reading this, will you marry me? This is the best hotel ever. Stay here fellows! Erick

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: Fzedlach
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be a Best Western. I'm not sure why it is a Days Inn now, but I'm guessing that it has something to do with Best Western no longer wanting its name associated with the hotel. When I stayed here several years ago, I felt like things were better. Pros: Location is excellent on arguably one of the best beaches in Maui, if not the world. Service was great and friendly. Very comfortable Tempurpedic beds. Free internet and free parking. Cons: Rooms are small (which I knew going in having stayed here before). Rooms in total disrepair. Cracked shower. Dingy bedspread (the hotel sprung for nice mattress' but neglected to care about the dingy disgusting bedding--who knows how often it gets cleaned!). Housekeeping service was SLOW...room wasn't cleaned until 3pm or so each day. Outside noise from the parking lot/restaurant nearby. No "Do Not Disturb signs."

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY, DISGUSTING, DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: milannicole
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel, excited that we were able to find a place for so cheap. Since we are not the type of people to stay around our hotel the whole vacation, we didn't see a need to pay the money for a resort. From the outside the grounds look really nice and the beach is by far one of the best, but its not a private beach so you can go there even if your not part of the Days Inn. When we got into our room I was disgusted. Since there is so many things I will list them in order: - The ceilings were black with dust. The fan was blowing it everywhere when you turned it on. - There were missing tiles on the floor. The floor was dirty. - The bed had an unidentifiable white/clear substance on the bed cover. - When I opened the dresser drawer there was a 1/4 full bottle of rum and a dirty mug. - The shower had dirt around the rim. Wow so much to list I can't remember it all. Either way it was not worth the money, even if its one of the cheapest place in Maui. I could understand if the place was run down and ugly, but there is no excuse for the dirtiness. Oh also to top it off when we handed in our keys and told the front desk we were not staying because of the above listed things they told us that we still needed to pay for the one night!!! The only thing I regret is not taking photos of this place to show you what I am talking about, but I was so stressed out, I couldn't even think but to just pack and go.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you don't mind a small room”
Reviews.Author: Countrygirl106
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but clean. Very close to the ocean-a big plus. If you don't plan on spending lots of time in your room, this is a great value. Our rooms were very quiet but some people did complain about noise. Easy to get around the island from this location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep in paradise”
Reviews.Author: brlf
Reviews.Content: While visiting Maui for a friend's wedding, my wife and I decided to find inexpensive lodgings, feeling that we would spend most of our time enjoying the island. After reading the reviews, we got exactly what we expected. A comfortable bed with little frills right in the middle of South Maui. We requested a second floor room to avoid the reported noise. We never experienced outside noise at an unreasonable time. The maintenance crew will run leaf blowers in the morning, but we were up and active by 8AM and it never interrupted any sleep. The hotel is a series of 6 or 7 buildings and we were located right in the middle. That may have insulated us from the beach/restaurant noise, 107 steps from my door to the beach, and from the street traffic. The only chance for noise was the door shared between our room and the adjacent one. I think I heard a toilet flush once and I think I could hear the shower. No big deal. My wife and I were probably the noisy ones. The hotel shares a parking space with a restaurant that provides valet parking. The valets will fill up the shared parking before taking cares across the street, so two nights we had to park across the street. No big deal, just worth a note if you are coming back before 9PM at night. Another note, the parking spots are very tight, so you may have a problem entering and exiting your vehicle when the lot is full. There was a section of the hallway on the first floor that collects water. It looks worse than it is, but Iâ€™ve seen it note a couple of times and wanted to address. I stepped in it more than once in sandals and my foot never got wet. Itâ€™s just a byproduct of them hosing down the sidewalks to remove sand or watering of the plants. That being said, the staff could mop/sweep the water away t o minimize the issue. Now the room. For as cheap as the room was, the bed was well worth it. Maybe Iâ€™m sleeping on crap at home, but every night it was a sound sleep. Linens were always changed and the cleanliness of the room was never in question. The room is quite small. Three drawers under the entertainment center with a decent sized CRT TV, a vanity station right behind the bathroom door, a small open closet for hanging a limited number of clothes, a safe and a decent sized bathroom. There were times my wife and I were interfering with each other trying to get ready, so I quickly learned to chill and enjoy a drink while surfing the very extensive cable TV lineup. There is also a coffee maker, iron and board and hair dryer. There is a small fridge that easily held half a case of water, a six pack of soda, a six pack of beer and bottle of wine. Side note, stop at K-Mart a few miles from the airport on your way to Kihei and stock up. Maui is expensive. One issue I had was internet access. When advertised, I was expecting access to be available in my room. While there is a DSL router in each of the rooms for the phone, you could only access the wifi internet in the lobby. The signal quickly fades about 10 feet outside the lobby doors. At first, this was upsetting and I spent an hour in the lobby the first night with my iPad. The second day my wife asked me I wanted to reserve an hour or so in our schedule to check my emails, but decided while I was in paradise, I was going to unplug. Iâ€™m glad I did. I only checked once more during the trip to confirm our flight status. The front desk will provide towels for the beach. Know this and donâ€™t pack towels. Save a pound in your suitcase. We traveled around the island as much as we could and our beach time often involved our friendâ€™s beaches that were staying at the Four Seasons and the Fairmount, but our beach may have been the best. There are large rocks in the water in some places, but there is a large stretch of the beach that was perfect for wading and boogie boarding and such. At the ends of the beach there were amazing snorkeling spots. Also, there are hotel chairs you can sit at, although a limited amount. The immediate area provides almost anything you need, although a little on the pricey side. You are within one mile from a ton of shops and restaurants in Kihei. The 10 minute stroll up to a Mexican establishment called Fredâ€™s was awesome at sunset and the trip back after dark was romantic. The hotel next door has a convenience store in the lobby and a surf shop to rent snorkel gear and other beach equipment. There is also a yoga shop toward its beach side that offers a $20 session at 8AM. The restaurant was on the pricey side and the food for the price was a little disappointing. Overall, this is a no frills hotel that gives you a great location and a good nights sleep while you enjoy the island of Maui. If you donâ€™t plan on spending more than a couple hours awake in your room and are not a picky traveler, this is a place for you. For the price, you canâ€™t beat it. We ended up paying a third of what our friends did staying in the resorts a mile to the south. If I had to do Maui again on the cheap, I would highly recommend it. If you are finicky about your accommodations, shell out the big bucks and stay at the resorts.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't know oceanfront meant restaurant right outside our window”
Reviews.Author: Fly2120
Reviews.Content: Booked for two nights, left after the first night. They warned us it may be a "little noisy"...what they didn't tell us was that if we kept our blinds open to enjoy the "ocean view" there were restaurant tables right outside our window. We could have reached out and grabbed an eggroll right off their plate. But even though this restaurant is intrusive, no discounts for motel guests. The noise and laughter went on past midnite as well as the piped in music from the adjoining restaurant that lasted till around midnight. They say its Maui, you don't spend your whole time in your room...that's true...but if you can't at least enjoy your sleep, what good is it. Also, the free wireless that they advertise didn't work in the rooms by the beach, had to go up front to the office. They do have tempurpedic mattresses, but beware. I thought it would be a good thing, but woke up with a back ache. They are not for everyone. I will say the staff was nice, and had no problem letting us leave after one night, crediting the following night. But no discounts for the sleepless night we spent there. And to think we paid 40 dollars extra for oceanfront. Maybe one of the front rooms would be OK, certainly would be quieter. Would I stay here again? NOT

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and comfy. Nice location.”
Reviews.Author: mononoke-hime
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night before leaving Maui, as I was flying home a day later than the group of friends I vacationed with. The location was nice - there was a large, populated beach behind the hotel with great snorkeling around the rocky reef areas. There were also several large parks, Kamaole Beach Parks, with grassy picnic areas within walking distance. It might help to have a rental car here - I walked 20 min to get to the nearest stores or shopping centers, and I believe it would've been an hour walk (3+ miles) to the downtown Kihei area. However, there are a couple restaurants next to the hotel. The room was small, but fine for one person. Everything was very clean, and the tempurpedic mattress was very comfortable! It also had both an AC unit and a ceiling fan - the other condo I stayed at did not have AC and got fairly warm. There was a little bit of noise pollution from the room next door. Both the microwave and small fridge were nice, but there were no utensils/plates/etc. The wifi also worked well in my room. The hotel staff was very accommodating, allowing me to check in early upon arrival and check out late the next day. They also gave me directions for nearby stores and buses back to the airport. I ended up ordering a cab instead because it was quicker and I didn't have to transfer vehicles multiple times. I did not see a resort fee on my bill. Good value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for, Aloha !”
Reviews.Author: Ft_Pierce_FlGreg99
Reviews.Content: Clean, fairly inexpensive, good snorkeling, great whale sighting, convenient, small hotel w/ great room, friendly service, excellent location, would do it again. My wife and I spent 2 weeks on Hawaii, visiting 3 Islands and this was a great stay. Island type rooms, great for couples, may need suite for 4 or more.

Reviews.Title: “I DO NOT recommend booking your stay here”
Reviews.Author: ch25
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room here for one night to go to a wedding. I didn't end up staying here and I know I am never going to stay here. People were having trouble when calling Maui hotels as they were becoming full for spring break so I actually booked through hotels.com which is usually very reliable. I ended up having to cancel and ended up going through a nightmare. My confirmation email said I had a certain window to cancel which I hadn't passed yet. The hotel claimed their policy was 72 hrs. In the end I was able to cancel easily through hotels.com after being subject to such terrible service over the phone from a women who I later found out was the general manager! She was making side remarks as I was speaking with her on the phone! I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: kttravels13
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very very small, with limited space for bags, toiletries, etc to spread out. You could also hear the neighbors in the room next door talking and watching TV. That said, it was clean and very reasonably priced. It was right next to a nice beach and a short drive to several other nice ones as well as Kihei and Wailea shopping. Overall for the budget-conscious traveler I'd definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a value for beachfront Maui!”
Reviews.Author: onepoormomma
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to find such a great little value right on the beach at the est end of Kihei! Set up like classic little bungalos, just steps from the ocean, our room offered the basics, decent bed, small bathroom, micro, fridge, dressing area, and breakfast nook area, along with a nice corner window and mounted air conditioning. If you want condo living this isn't it. But who needs to spend time in a room when you're in Maui? We actually were thrilled that our Wyndham Rewards points were able to score us 3 free nights here! Keep that in mind if you use their credit card! It runs otherwise in the mid $100 range. I found the hotel quiet, friendly and impeccably clean! Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kris-Hansen
Reviews.Content: The rooms may be small but we were not there to stay in our room. Has a small refrigerator, coffee maker, microwave. The internet never worked in the room but worked in the office (slow). If you snorkel it is a great beach for doing that. We saw just as many things here as we did on our dive trip. A+ beach. People said parking was a problem, we didn't have any problems but it is a public beach and parking here.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: 2011IslandGirl
Reviews.Content: Like most of the reviews, this hotel was not what we expected. The rooms are unusually small, although they do have coffee pot, fridge and micro. The housekeeping service was fine. We paid $165 a night for an "ocean view" room. When we arrived and went to our room, I was beyond disappointed. This room (209) did have a small balcony but the view was blocked by huge trees. I immediately went right back to the office and complained. I even wanted to be moved, why pay for "view" when you do NOT have a view. The staff was not willing to move us or discount our room. I was furious but you are on vacation and pretty much stuck. When we went to the office for beach towels, they were out! Seriously? It was 8 AM and no towels? The whole week, we never once were able to get "beach" towels and ended up using our room towels. There are no chairs for beach use. Sorentos, their restaurant is at the end of the parking lot, which made our evenings extremely noisy. The parking is horrible as Sorento customers seem to get priority. Most of the nights we were back before sunset so it wasn't a problem for us but others did complain about the parking issue. We were not offered any discounts or coupons and no mention of using the restaurant next door was offered. No internet worked while we were here and the lobby computer was "down" and was never repaired within the week we were staying here. Frustrating. We are not fancy people and do not expect much, but when I pay for ocean view that is what we want. There is a beautiful condo unit right next to this hotel, which is where we will stay next time. Beautiful pool, nice lawn area, MANY chairs for you to lounge on. On the positive side, this is a great location. (Kihei) The beach is very nice. Great water for snorkeling and just playing around. Beautiful views on the beach and walking is pleasant. Morning walks were nice, not too much traffic, and many stores are close enough to walk to. I will never stay here and do not recommend this hotel. Although I do recommend this area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you don't plan to spend time in your room”
Reviews.Author: wrldhkr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn Oceanfront for 2 nights last week as part of a longer Maui vacation. We had just spent 2 nights at the Aston Ka'anapali Shores on West Maui. The Days Inn had good reviews, and was a price we could afford, so we went with it. The location is good - right on a great beach. Next door are more condos and hotels. There's a restaurant at the end of the hotel at beachside - we didn't try it but we saw wedding parties eating there both nights. The dining lanai is actually right in front of the oceanfront ground floor rooms - so beware of paying for an oceanfront room and then having to keep your blinds shut for privacy! The motel is 5 or 6 separate blocks, each 2 stories. There are 8 rooms on each floor. The 4 corner rooms on each floor have 2 windows on the corners, and a small bathroom window. The 4 inner rooms have only 1 smallish window, and no window in the bathroom. The property has a slight grade, so on the uphill side, the ground floor rooms look at a concrete retaining wall about 3' high with some plants separating each building. We had requested at time of purchase through Expedia a view room - however we got a ground floor interior room facing the concrete retaining wall. I've stayed at a lot of hotels and motels of all grades for business and pleasure - and this room was amongst the smallest and most cramped. Our room was about 10'x10'. The "king" bed (smaller than a regular king size for sure) took up most of the room. In addition, all the rooms have AC units mounted INTO the rooms - taking up precious interior space. It was dark and felt like a basement. The bathrooms are small as well with a shower, no tub. After checking out the room, we went back to the front desk, and asked about availability of any other rooms. She told us the only ones left were in the same situation - ground floor, 1 window, facing the walls. I mentioned asking for a nicer room at booking (over 1 month before) and got the impression that they didn't read the request and that the room was just allotted at the time we checked in. The price is still good for a beachfront motel, but don't expect a place to hang out. We envied the neighboring condo, which had 8-10 stories of oceanfront rooms all with balconies. Also, other than the stair and deck access to the upper stories, there are no porches or balconies to hang out on. It's really a no frills place to sleep. Please note there are no additional facilities such as pool, fitness center, business center, etc. They did tell us there would be WiFi throughout the motel, but it apparently was not working during our stay. You could use a computer station in the small lobby. There is a mini fridge in the room and a microwave. While we were disappointed with the room (especially compared to the hotel we had just stayed in on West Maui), it was clean, and did the job. We spent most of our time at the beach and just came back to sleep. At least the parking was free.

Reviews.Title: “Who needs a condo when you can say here!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBear
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 235 (2nd Floor) from February 2 - 12. The room was perfect for what we needed. It is quite small but it has a mini fridge, enough for our groceries for a few days, a microwave, so we could warm our oatmeal for breakfast, and a coffee pot. The nice thing about a hotel versus a condo - you get fresh towels from the front desk daily, just sign them out, and you get unlimited amounts of ice! We bought a styrofoam cooler for the 10 days to take along with us on our daily adventures and filled it up every morning at the hotel. They also have laundry services which work well, for a small fee. The beds were very comfortable and the resort was quiet. I read that sometimes it's difficult to find parking but we had no problem. This is our second time to Maui and had a condo the first time and the space was nice but the hotel worked just as well. We ate at Sorentos our last night there and I wish we would have eaten there earlier! Their mushroom bruscetta is to die for! Impecable service as well and you are right on the ocean! You also get a discount coupon for the resort next to you for breakfast which was quite delicious too...eat on the ocean and watch the whales! All in all, we had a great experience here and would be willing to stay agin! Thanks to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: Dave493
Reviews.Content: This is a superb location on the best beach in Maui. The problem with this motel is that the rooms are very small and routine maintenance is being neglected. Our unit had a broken toilet seat, non-functioning smoke detector, and blinds that were broken. Another problem is parking. The spaces are very small and a full size car or Van will not fit. An up scale restaurant shares the site so parking in the evening is a real problem. For a short stay the location and low cost is probably worth putting up with the shortcomings but a little more attention to maintenance would definitely be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than hoped for in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Haolie
Reviews.Content: This is a very good value in a great location. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable enough for two, got to be friendly though. Excellent Keawakapu Beach is no more than 100 feet from the most distant rooms, though you won't have an ocean view unless you walk those 100 feet. . I went by myself and my wife's comment on my hotel and in-room pictures was, "Really, not bad at all". I had no problem with noise, I asked for and received an upstairs corner unit, which was fine. Turn on the fan or air conditioner if you want to mask outside sounds. For golfers it is in an ideal location. Wailea and Makena close by and central Maui courses no more than 10 miles. Many Kihei restaurants are within one or two miles. Come on, you can walk to most, I'm 70 and I made it. If I ever get back to Maui I'll certainly look into the Maui Oceanfront again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: SouthDakotaHawaiiFan
Reviews.Content: Will definitely stay here when we return. Yes, the rooms are small and aside from an awesome bed it does lack many frills, however we don't go to Maui to spend time cooped up on our room! Room does have a small refrigerator and microwave which is convenient. I don't recommend the oceanfront rooms as they are right in front and next to a restaurant (some restaurant tables were right outside our window). This neighboring restaurant plays music long into the night and the patrons can be quite noisy making it impossible to have your windows open for the sea breezes. Next time we'll book a room further back. That said, this hotel is footsteps to the beach, had an endless supply of beach towels to check out and is also close to shops just up the road. This hotel is also located on one of the most beautiful beaches on the island and the walk up and down this and it's adjoining beaches is so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK, for $100 per night”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum64152
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, very small. There were several people at front desk very helpful and the others were not helpful at all. For around $100 per night itâ€™s OK to stay there, any more choose another hotel. The beach is nice, not enough hot water on three occasions, only stayed three days, and had hot enough hot water one of those days, not a good rate. The room was quiet so we could sleep well, that was a big plus. Bed was comfortable. No chair to sit on beach was a drawback. Their recliner chairs are on a grassy part and cannot be moved to sand

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value by the beach”
Reviews.Author: JoyM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on one of the most popular and lovely beaches in the Kihei area and a great value. Most rooms do not have oceanfront views but the ocean is a few steps away. The rooms are nice although small and I did not have any problems with noise. I was in a second floor room, room 214. SInce I was just one person, the small amount of closet space was not a problem. I did not even use all the dresser drawers. Some people or a couple might have felt a bit cramped. I would recommend a second floor room if you are concerned about noise at all. The cleaning crew came through regularly each day, but the hotel has what is a common policy now, which is if you leave your towels up, you are not asking for them to be cleaned, only if they are on the floor. I did not want towels cleaned until the end of my stay (I stayed 4 night, 12/14-12/17). You can also check out beach towels at the front desk which is convenient and there is a computer with free internet access in the lobby for accessing email. This was great since I did not lug a laptop with me. There is a laundry room with a soda machine accessed by room key near the front desk area. There is snorkeling along the beach and a reef which has a fair amount of fish. The sea turtles were there ( one swam right past me) and people said they could hear whale song, although I wasn't sure if I heard anything. People come here to snorkel and paddle out on boards and other water sports but the beach was not crowded , at least when I was on it (I went out mostly in the AM and also for evening strolls) and had a nice family feel. There isn't breakfast service at the hotel but you get a discount coupon for the hotel next door. However, that hotel , which is just a walk across the grass from the Days Inn, has a store where you can buy deli items, groceries and other sundries, as well as baked goods, and I bought what I needed for food from them during my stay. It was considerably more reasonable than eating at a restaurant. The drive along the road in Kihei to the hotel is somewhat stripmallish, but there are beaches all along the road, and some decent places to get lunch. I tried the Maui Taco place (if that is the correct name) which has no bathrooms but is decent food. You can walk along the beach all the way down through the resorts in Wailea (I am not checking spelling) , where a walkway goes up after about a half mile to mile so that you can see the views higher up from the cliffs as well as how the people plumping down twice or three times or more what you are paying at the Days Inn are paying for. However, I didn't think any beach there was better than the beach right outside the Days Inn. If I had wanted to just do beaches, I could have easily stayed here a longer time, and for the price it is a deal. I read a review about the seafront suites not being as advertised, and Sorrento's is busy at night, but I didn't ask or care about a seaview in the room, since I was going out to see things, not staying in my room. There are outdoor reclining chairs on the lawn right before you enter the beach at the hotel (this hotel runs along a relatively narrow strip from beach to road, and at the back there is a lawn right before you get on the sand; so most rooms are along the walkway. but all are just a short distance to the beach; possibly it is louder on the first floor, although I did not notice a lot of activity along the walkways at night). People come for the beach during the day and then leave at night, unless they are going to the Sorentos restaurant or to the restaurant at the hotel next door. Or unless they are staying at the hotels all night of course. But the grounds of that other hotel and the Days Inn merge, and there are no real restrictions in terms of walking between them. It just leads to a nice feeling, I didn't think there was any problem as far as people not at the hotels causing problems. The parking lot on one side of the hotel is hotel only, on the other side is shared with people coming to the beach during the day time. I always used the lot smaller lot on the hotel entrance side, and never had a problem parking. However, I did not go out at night and was usually parked if I had driven anywhere by sunset. Mostly at this hotel you don't really need to drive except to go visit nearby beaches if you want to. South from the hotel you are in the resort area with divided streets and a luxury feel. The Days Inn is right on the border between the luxury area of Wailea and the more regular folks area of Kihei. So you can check out both worlds just walking around . It's an easy drive down to Makena beach and further on to the lava flow area. A short drive north besides the Kihei business area is the Humpback Whale Sanctuary and you can easily drive around the bay to where you get whale watching trips with Pacific Whale Foundation.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading advertising”
Reviews.Author: bashfulliz
Reviews.Content: We would not recommend this hotel to anyone! We arrived at 1am only to find urine stained sheets on our bed. We slept on top of the covers & complained about the sheets in the morning, it took housekeeping until 3 or 4pm to change our sheets. We rented an oceanfront/view room. It does have oceanfront beach, but it's blocked by bushes. We could NOT see the ocean from our room due to the bushes, but MAINLY due to the fact that Sarento's (onsite restaurant) has seating in the area directly behind the oceanfront room, blocking our windows! We could NOT open our windows unless we wanted to be part of the diner's conversations! What is NOT listed on the website is the fact that a PUBLIC ACCESS walkway is directly next to the hotel, which was next to our room! Whether or not you are ready to wake up at 5 or 6am, you will be woke up by passerby's. The parking situation is NOT good. There is a paved lot in front of the hotel, but good luck getting a spot there, especially when Sarento's is busy, and uses the available spots for VALET parking! The gravel lot behind the hotel is always packed, due to the public access to the beach & the overflow parking from the restaurant. We had read about the rooms & were not suprised by the size, but were suprised by the spiders, ants & flying bugs that stayed in our room & bathroom! Don't expect any privacy in your bathroom, either, because there is ONLY an opaque window (no curtains) between you and the public! If you turn on your light in the bathroom, shower & walk around, everyone outside will know you are in there! We did not complain about the room until we checked out, and we were greeted with a blank stare & an "ok". We called the manager (Bob) when we returned home & we were told it's our fault, we should have complained while we were there & they would have moved us. I'd like to know where they would have moved us to, because the hotel was booked solid according to the website the day before we arrived on Maui! We would recommend avoiding this hotel and spending a little more elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “great location and aloha price!”
Reviews.Author: paulhogan5169
Reviews.Content: friendly, warm and clean every day! What a gem of a hiding place...smaller rooms but very comfortable bed and pillow..adequate bathroom and fridge for our food. The table in the room had a view to the ocean and we enjoyed making our own salads and watching the TV with glimpses and sounds of the waves. The lawn out the front right on the beach was wonderful to relax and read as we watched the boarders, snorkelling etc...wonderful views of the island and the weather was beautiful!!! Thankyuo to the management and cleaning team for giving us a pleasurable break.

Reviews.Title: “nice but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: lawyer01
Reviews.Content: For maui prices, we found this hotel to be a good deal. They did a good job making this hotel look tropical. We had a refirde and microwave, which was nice. The staff was friendly and they offer free internet in the lobby. We think that Kihei is a good location in order to get to the sights that we went to. And there are penty of things to do and places to eat. Its very close to the upscale resort area and mall. Our only complaints were that the room and bathroom was very small. Also we got a first floor room right on the ocean and paid only about $15 extra to be right on the ocean. We were disappointed to find that there was only one little tiny window in the corner that didt even look out directly onto the ocean - it more so looked out onto the restaurant at the hotel. There was no patio door going out onto the beach. The second floor rooms on the ocean did have a big balcony over looking the ocean. So if you want an ocean view room there, pay the extra for the 2nd floor suites. We didtn even feel like we were ont he ocean in the 1st floor room. That was the other problem that we had; the restaurant patio music was loud and we could hear it even with our windows closed and air on. We wanted to leave the window open to hear the waves. I called the front desk and they said that they would do their best to try to get them to turn it down or off. They did so after about a half hour. For the price of $100 in Kiehi on the ocean, this was a good place to stay; just dont plan to spend much time in the tiny room!

Reviews.Title: “Not a very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Thom S
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are tiny and dirty. The bathroom is about the size as the ones you find on a jet. They had an air conditioner unit that hung over the bed.....very difficult to fall asleep without thinking of your head getting crushed in the middle of the night. Parking is HORRIBLE and overall, the place is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - super location”
Reviews.Author: churchp
Reviews.Content: Nice location right on beautiful beach. Room small but big enough and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: jenl175
Reviews.Content: the staff were amazing, the location was perfect, and the price was killer! just a fantastic stay!!! ps the beach is like stones throw away which is great!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: krawner
Reviews.Content: Pros: Right on the beach in Kihei (although you will probably NOT have an ocean view since only 4 of the rooms have a view). New furnishings. Tempurpedic mattress. A/C, microwave, and mini fridge. Free parking. Awesome price-- <$90/night on a weekend in November. Nearby shop on beach rents surfboards, boogie boards and stand up paddle boards. Free wifi. Cons: No pool. Parking lot is crammed, especially at night when the neighboring restaurant is open. Waited over an hour for a room, even though checked in past 3PM. Rooms are on the smaller side (you definitely would not want 4 people in 1 room).

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Dave327
Reviews.Content: Staff is extremely friendly and eager to help make your stay successful. It is an easy walk from your room to the beach. Refrigerator and microwave in each room helps keep meal budget affordable.Beds are Tempur-pedic mattresses - very comfortable. The property is extremely clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT YOU GET FOR THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: letsgonow2
Reviews.Content: Reasonable rates. If paid in advance, good discounts. Very small rooms, small bathrooms, but clean. Rooms have a small fridge and microwave. Limited storage space. Nice sandy beach is about 100 feet from the hotel, no pool. Nice restaurant in the same lot, but not part of the hotel. Very nice food, but on the higher side.

Reviews.Title: “Charming room close to necessities”
Reviews.Author: KitHonolulu
Reviews.Content: I booked online for a discount, and only stayed two days for a wedding. Although small, the room was charming and very clean. Tempurpedic mattress was very comfortable. The refridgerator, coffee maker, and microwave were a pleasant surprise. All personnel were very pleasant from the first telephone inquiry until the ease of checkout. Being just a stone's throw away from several retail outlets, ie) grocery, fast food etc. was convenient. I would definetly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “DAYS INN BARGAIN FOR OCEAN FRONT HOTEL IN MAUI”
Reviews.Author: shellsfam
Reviews.Content: We had not planned on a trip to maui. The airlines had such a bargain we found ourselve wanting to head to Hawaii, but did not have a large budget for resort living. we spent one night at this hotel and surely could have spent the whole week there. It is Keihe so centrally located and minutes from the ocean shore. Closer than almost any of the resorts where have to walk 10 minuates just to get out ot the building. It is not fancy. the rooms are basic and small- but clean. One huge advantage is it has a refr igerator in the room. The beach in front of the hotel is great for walking and swimming. No pool. but do have lounge chairs. They have BBQ grills and picnic tables to cook on if want. there is no contenintal breakfast. A wonderful Italian restaurant Sorrentos is right next dorr and has wonderful food and a great setting right on the beach . great sunsets at this location. we paid 109.00 with AAA discount for 1 queen bed.
