If you cant afford to spend a ton of money - but desire to go to Hawaii definately stay here Or use you money for other things like fine dining and snorkling extcursions, renatal cars etc. aloha

Reviews.Title: “good hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: GabbyRN
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at the Days Inn because our days in Kihei would be filled with activities that kept us away from the hotel, therfore we didn't need a pricey high end resort. It is a nice, clean hotel- just don't expect that resort feel- no pool area, no balconies or sliding doors. It is on a great stretch of beach and was perfect for what we needed- a place to sleep and shower! Front desk staff was so unfriendly- the evening girl on Sept 3, 2010 wouldn't even look up from texting to assist me with finding the phone # for Mama's Fish House- I'm surprised she handed me the phone book.

Reviews.Title: “Cat Pee?”
Reviews.Author: PQBrown
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the room I stayed in: "Did a cat get stuck in here?" It smelled. Literally. And that was probably the highlight. The room was terribly small. The furniture was terribly dated. The promise of a continental breakfast was a terrible lie. When asked, the morning front desk person told me that the line (on holder of my key card) should have been "crossed out." Instead I was given a coupon for a restaurant next door that was closed. If you have a choice to sleep under a tree or at this motel, you would be wise to choose the tree.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Honeymoon on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: BruinSeattle
Reviews.Content: After spending way too much on our wedding, my husband and I almost skipped the honeymoon. We are so glad we didn't! We ended up finding cheap tickets to Maui and had our eye on the Days Inn since it got good reviews and seemed like a cheap option. We booked the night before our departure and got an amazing deal (book directly through the Days Inn website for the best deals). The online reviews were accurate - we expected a small, clean room with no frills but a great beach, nearby restaurants, and the cheapest prices anywhere. That's exactly what we got. Plus, the beds are SO comfortable, I have never had such a good night's sleep at a hotel. If you are traveling on a budget, you really can't beat this hotel. It's on a gorgeous beach with a beautiful reef right off the hotel property (my husband saw sea turtles in this little reef!), it's on a great central part of the island that's not in the center of town but close enough to easily find shops and restaurants, and it's right next door to great food at the Five Palms and Sorrento. You can even rent beach towels from the font desk, and you can rent all types of beach gear (including paddle boards and snorkels) from the hotel next door. My only word of caution is to be careful parking in the small lot out front - our car door got dinged and we were worried about being charged for the damage by the rental company (turns out the rental company didn't care, but it stressed us out nonetheless). You might try parking in the larger gravel lot behind the Inn, which is almost the same distance from the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “SPECTACULAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: gclairz
Reviews.Content: Perfect for my needs with an extraordinary location and unbelievably reasonable rates for what you get. RU kidding me with even having Temperpedic mattresses/pillows?! OMG, that's unbelievable and a given for a perfect night's sleep. All employees have been VERY NICE too, so the ALOHA spirit runs all thru-out. Thanks so much for enhancing my trip to Maui... Gail from Hermosa Beach, CA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: travellingbluebell
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Days Inn Kihei. I haven't written a review before, but was so happy here that I felt I wanted to share that. The rooms are small, but i was travelling alone so that was ok for me. They have really nice shutters and tile floors so easy to get a breeze and keep clean. I found the cleaning very good, even after bringing in sand from the beach. As i was travelling alone, security is always upmost in my mind and i always felt safe here. It is a friendly place, but no one gets in your way, it is right on the beach which is almost a private beach as you are surrounded by a big hotel to the right (with a nice cafe and expensive little shop, bike hire etc) and then private residents to the left. There is also a nice bit of grass to sunbathe on and the water around there is safe to swim, not too many waves. The staff were helpful and you could use the internet in the office at any time (there is wifi too, but i didn't have a laptop), there is a small gym, just a running machine and bike and some free weights, a good laundry room and you are really close to the town, other restaurants and you can walk home from the bars. There is a bus stop right outside too and plenty of car parking. It is not the 4 Seasons, but it was safe, clean and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: kymwana
Reviews.Content: Rooms SMALL! Had to ask for towels the night we got there. Then 2 days later we had to ask for someone to come clean the room, empty the waste basket. We then had to go to the office late at night and ask for more towels. The next day we had to ask for toilet paper. Then Thursday night we get back late, get ready for bed and the bed is soaked in water, the floor and my clothes on a chair are soaked. The air conditioner had broken and leaked everywhere. So I call the office, and they put us in another room for the night. Friday night we have a family with 7 children running all over the upper hall way, screaming and yelling, slamming doors. At midnight we finally contact the office, they do nothing. Sat. night the same thing only worse, kids are pounding on our windows, running screaming, finally at 2:00 AM. we go to the office again. We had to leave at 4:00 AM to catch our flight home. The office didn't offer us anything compensations for our lost time, lost sleep, wet clothes with air conditioners leakage on them, they offered us nothing. A dive. Oh and free WIFI, didn't work for the first couple of days, and when it did it was to slow to work.

Reviews.Title: “quiet location on beach, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: PROS: right on a nice beach very quiet property small and cozy- not a huge resort I got a great deal (66$/night) - by far the best you can get on maui rooms were clean very close to many shops and restaraunts CONS: rooms were small I did not like tile floors in room - but it is good for cleaning sand i suppose only one choice for bedding (1 queen) - and no room for extra bedding no fitness center limited services- restaurant onsite was pricey and crowded at night parking at night could be crowded due to popularity of restaurant on site very basic furnishings in room no pool - beach only i was not planning on being in the room for the stay - out sightseeing the island adn this property was located in central/south maui, right in middle of island so it was a good base to venture out from everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Lisa7562
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in June 2010. The room and location was perfect for our needs. No need to cross the road to get to the beach, simply walk out of your room onto a nice swimming beach. Next door hotel has good happy hour (food and beverage). Free parking, comfy bed, free internet in reception area and laundry facilities make this great value. Minor drawbacks - no balcony (we were on ground floor) so it was impossible to dry your towels/swimmers and it's always nice to sit outside. They do have an area with lounges on the grassed area near the beach that we sat on which was nice, but obviously you couldn't leave any belongings unattended. At the time we stayed, there were about 4 'undesirable' people drinking next to this area from early evening into the night. As this is a public area, I'm not sure if the hotel can do anything about it but it would feel a lot more relaxing if they moved on.

Reviews.Title: “you call this oceanfront?”
Reviews.Author: jcw1988
Reviews.Content: Spur of the moment getaway with my husband - looked around and found the rate agreeable ($150.00) for a one night stay at the beach. Did not expect much (I live on Maui and know the resorts and hotels and KNEW this was a dirt cheap rate, AND a Days Inn, not a resort and spa) Anyway, the room was called "Ocean Front" I expected a window larger than a chalkboard to view the ocean. Dissapointed. The room was a very small, MAYBE 10X10 and outside the window was a patio that the next door restaurant used for outdoor seating! there was a party of 10-12 people inches away from our window/wall was having dinner!! could not even watch the sunset from our room. Buyer beware on how hotels advertise their room.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Oceanfront; Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Ash-n-Ash
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Oceanfront when it was owned by Best Western, We were camping out in a VW Bus rental and decided we needed to have a clean bed and a shower. It was by pure accident that we found the hotel; the price was the best we could find, the bed was fantastic and the beach was perfect! We have stayed twice and returned with our family. The location is great and everyone enjoyed it. The rooms are fairly small, but who goes to Maui to sit in a hotel room? The front desk staff is very helpful and friendly. Every time we have stayed at the Oceanfront it has been during the off season so the cost is less and there are very few people on the beach at the hotel. Perfect! For meals, I highly recommend Da Kitchen and Maui Tacos and both restaurants are just down the street. They are not for people who want a sit down, romantic meal, but for those of you who are on Maui time. We like to go get take out and just sit on the beach at the hotel. The restaurant at the hotel is quite pricey, but it smells delicious. I would recommend the Oceanfront to anyone visiting Maui who enjoy the basics! My partner and I are planning to return for a weekend getaway next weekend. This will be our first time back since Days Inn took over; I will post an update when we return. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful beaches and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: retsmah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Oceanfront for ten nights, we are already planning on returning next year. Can't wait to return it will be our fourth time we have stayed at the hotel. People are friendly, service is great. The location of the hotel is perfect to the beaches, restaurants, golfing and shopping. Can' wait to return to MAUI

Reviews.Title: “Want to get to Maui, but don't have the cash? Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: ahughes517
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during most of our honeymoon. The room was clean, but tiny (even for two people.) You can hear your neighbors very clearly (conversations, hairdriers, party music, etc.) We didn't spend much time in the room, and the beach at the hotel is just fine. However, if you've always wanted to go to Maui and didn't have the cash for $300+ per night hotels, it's not too bad. Skip the Italian restaurant next to the hotel - overpriced and too dark (even for those looking for a romantic dinner.) However, DO eat at the hotel next door (to the right when you're looking out at the ocean from the hotel.) Excellent staff - we ate two meals there and enjoyed them both. Would I stay there again? Only if I had to. But, if it's what gets you to Hawaii, make sure you have plenty of day excursions planned - you won't want to spend too much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Small. Don't Ask for the Oceanfront Room!”
Reviews.Author: jracleveland
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night. This trip was our "pre-honeymoon honeymoon" to visit my in-laws while they were at a private house on Maui for 3 weeks. My father-in-law upgraded us to the oceanfront room as a nice and thoughtful gesture. I cannot stress enough that our room's porch was the outdoor dining area for the restaurant. We came back to the hotel on the first night and 10 people were sitting directly outside our window drinking, laughing, and talking loudly. The table was literally up against our window. If you are on a budget and don't plan on spending time at your hotel or in your room, then this hotel is fine for you. But if you have a family or are planning on an extended stay (more than a few days), stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well located... just dont expect too much and it'll work for you”
Reviews.Author: kidlid21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the days inn in early March 2010. I would say in terms of amenities, this is probably a 2 star hotel. However, when it comes to cleanliness and reliability, I'd say its a very good hotel (and hence my good ratings). The room was clean, the hotel is located right next to a decent beach and just down the main kihei strip. The rooms are smallish but not hostel small and certainly big enough if your major activity is going to be to fall asleep before hitting the island the next day (afterall this is Maui). If you're more of a person/couple who lounges in your hotel for a few hours every day... then perhaps this place will be too small/simple for you. We didn't really watch much TV so i can't comment on prior posts regarding this. The AC and fan worked well (though it wan't too hot to begin with in March). The bathroom was reasonable (someone had complained about lack of toilet paper... there were about 4 extra rolls in our room). Parking was a little tricky, but there was always a space available in their private lot while we were there. Not sure what else to say... its a basic, clean room. Good for budget travelers who want to spend their $ on Maui activities rather than lodging. They had a great special at the time we booked and there were no added fees... so i'm pretty satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eugene34
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel. Perfect price, perfect location and perfect hotel with a beautiful beach. Beds are very comfortable, rooms hace fridge and microwave. The service at the front desk is outstanding. Maui is, by far, more beautiful than Oahu, so if I ever go back to Maui, I wouldn't doubt to choose the Days Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanfront It Is!”
Reviews.Author: NWWildTurtle
Reviews.Content: Unless you rent a condo or pay top dollar, you won't find anywhere closer to a beautiful beach in Kihei than the Maui Oceanfront. The Manager Rate was excellent, the room very clean and comfortable. If you can't do stairs, be sure to request a ground floor room. We were on the second floor of the front building with parking in the gravel lot next door. The rooms at the front don't have any traffic noise. The walls are a little thin - we had a person in the adjoining room who was up every morning at 3, we assume to go photograph sunrise somewhere - but otherwise didn't hear anything.........including the tsunami evacuation warning. The beach in front of the hotel is fantastic, clean, and joins with the Kamaole beaches to make a morning walk of several miles. We have friends who ate at the on-site restaurant - Sorrento's - who said it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: PatrickEE
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much more than an incredible beach, so was very pleasantly surprised that the rooms were very clean and the beds were great - very comfortable. We have stayed the last 2 years at the Mana Kai, so knew the beach, but wanted a more affordable option. The Days Inn was it. The rooms are small but clean and the beds are great. The pillows killed me, but must not have been that bad as I did not seek an alternate. The TV also gave up the ghost the last night we were there. The value and location more than make up for any complaint - really who goes to Hawaii to stay in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jeepinsedona
Reviews.Content: The location is top notch. Keawakapu beach is my favorite on Maui and the Days Inn sits right on this beach. You can walk out of your room with your coffee and right down to beach each morning. Staff was friendly, room was clean. The only detail is the room was TINY. I was in the cheapest room they had during high season, and opted for a single queen bed. The room was so small it bordered on being claustrophobic. It was clean though and nice and the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “It was pretty good last year but getting run down”
Reviews.Author: iwantto
Reviews.Content: Last year my wife and I enjoyed it when it was a Best Western product. This year as a Day's Inn product, we went there with my mom-in-law and had asked 3 month's prior to have ajoining rooms since she is getting infirm and we were assured that this was possible. On arrival, the 2 rooms that were had reserved were taken and all they could do was put my wife and I on one side of the building and my mom-in-law on the other side. The next day, we moved to 2 ajoining rooms and were told that the managers policy was that no ajoining room doors were allowed to be used, so we only had the access through the facing main doors to check on her. The other things that were remiss with our rooms were that there was no exhaust fan in my mom-in-law's bathroom and the on/off switch for the main lamp in our room needed to be fixed. While we were staying there and talking to other guests they had various problems with toilets that continually ran, sinks that didn't drain and screens that were torn. Of course, I didn't witness any of this but if this is a sample of problems, what is really wrong? For location and cleaning staff, I would give it 3 stars but for the rooms in general maybe 1/2 star, little better than a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal”
Reviews.Author: o15
Reviews.Content: We had a little bit of difficulty because of a canceled reservation( on their part) They made everything right. The location is great for watching the whales breach and the sunset. We were able to snorkel rtght off the beach. Ask for the room on the second floor ocean front. a great deat in comparison to the hight priced big hotels.

Reviews.Title: “worst place I've ever stayed in 36 years of travel!”
Reviews.Author: ipuiolie
Reviews.Content: Regardless of grade of room,all have tile floors;that they only sweep ! Which makes for filthy feet. Parking at night (from 5p.m.- 11:00 p.m.) is horrendous! Sarentos Restaurant does Valet parking ONLY. Instead of using un-lit "public parking" at back of hotel,they use hotel parking lot. Making hotel guest struggle for spot. Or risk break-in of vehicle in the "public parking lot." (Restaurant is not owned by hotel.) First time I had my room cleaned;came back from running to find towels taken - not replaced,other items I did not want removed,removed,shower uncleaned. AND door to room not properly closed . As in ANYONE COULD HAVE GONE IN !!!! Reported this to front desk and housekeeping immmediately ! NEVER recieved call from head of housekeeping,Manager or Gen. Manager. Stayed 8 nights (nowhere else to go). But heard nothing from Manager until day before check-out,at which time I ran into him at front desk. Said he had "just heard about it "that morning. Sure he did. Because I never heard from anyone,did not have my room cleaned after first time. Did not trust it wouldn't happen again - of course ! Having gotten no response from anyone. Manager ONLY took off $50 late check out fee. For handycap people; they have two spots outside office. One was used by hotel truck 8 out of the 9 days I was there. Even after bringing it to the Office's attention ! Only nice thing there; Right on very nice beach. Even if given a week's free stay - would NEVER EVER stay there again. EVER. FIRST bad experience with staying at a Day's Inn. For cost of rooms;while they list a lot of channels,they don't ACTUALLY have them. Have a card in room saying;Forgot something? See us at Front desk. (Or something like that.) Called. They have NOTHING. Fitness Center; Never saw it. Only open from 9-5. Usually hotels have until at least 9 or 10 p.m. Who uses a workout center during the day when staying in a beach area? Hello! No printer attatched to their "community" computer. And they allow 10 min. use only.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs, no joke”
Reviews.Author: cencalsurfer
Reviews.Content: I visited Maui for a wedding and me and a buddy picked the Maui Oceanfront for it's location and value. Not wanting to sleep in the same bed, we requested the pull out bed and after three days - I had severe bed bug rashes!!! I confronted the hotel manager and he said he would reimburse my stay, but never followed through! two words: STAY AWAY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “you may get less than what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: G_travelin
Reviews.Content: We booked a second floor ocean view room and we were told all of the rooms are ocean view (not true at all; half are not), and we were given a down stairs room that had two windows that opened up onto two tables in the neighboring restaurant (room 101). However, they were nice enough to find us another room. They told us that we could get the AAA discount at $107 and said all was good. Upon checkout, we were charged the higher price ($139). Then the counter person told us that the AAA price was $116.95 and told us that she was going to credit my account. A week later, I talked to them and they said that we would not get the AAA rate. I am bummed that I left such a good tip for the housekeeper, which we left because we thought we were being taken care of. But, a decent room for a low cost. True, they are very very small. I would suggest you find a nicer room and pay a few extra $$.

Reviews.Title: “One Star”
Reviews.Author: monsterVA
Reviews.Content: They tell you the rooms are 250 square feet and truly they are very small. Three drawers, so be prepared to live out of your suitcase except for the things you can hang up. Ran out of toliet paper one evening and the office refused to give me another roll, that is why they get one star. Run out of tp in a well runn Inn? Not likely. They provide one package of coffee a day, no cream or sugar. Beds were nice. The location is not great- far away from everything we had planned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lil Secret”
Reviews.Author: otalay
Reviews.Content: Rooms small, but great location and clean rooms a lil on the older side but worth it if you are out and about staying busy and you are not looking to sit in the room all day.( as you shouldn't be in Maui) This is the place for you..... The beach is very nice and there is outside showers to rinse with and the snorkeling is minimal but not far away is great snorkeling. I stayed here for 8 days and had no problems......

Reviews.Title: “good location, small rooms - great value”
Reviews.Author: Londonrevue
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Days Inn after staying at a really nice resort...which probably taints the review a bit. The rooms were quite small and the decor aged, but it looks like they are in the midst of some renovations - so maybe it was just the rooms we were in. The location and price are unbeatable, and if you're going to be doing lots of exploring (like we were) the appearance of the room didn't matter much. Our first room had a monster cockroach, and they graciously moved us up to the closest room to the ocean (103). The beds are really comfortable and the beach is gorgeous albeit busy.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely fell in love,Staff,outstanding cannot wait to return”
Reviews.Author: pmwlaw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed the hotel, maid-service and staff tremendously.We are middle-age folks and cannot express the services extended to us. The rooms are small but so clean and quaint. We went swimming 3-4 times daily what a wonderful experience. We explored the whole town and everyone was so friendly. We are native californians,but cannot wait to return to the Days Inn Maui OceanFront I treated my wife to Maui for her 50th birthdat gift. We have wonderful pics but i do not know how to post

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and affordable accomodation right on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleZubidoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn Maui for 4 nights and had a very positive experience. The bed was very comfortable, the room was clean, A/C worked well and TV was nice too. The main benefit to staying at this hotel is walking out your door and onto the gorgeous beach with fabulous snorkeling, etc. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful as well. We'll be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located and cheaper, but small.”
Reviews.Author: greshamtennisguy
Reviews.Content: The location is great, but parking is a hassle because of a restaurant sharing the lot - you can park in a lot for the beach access, but security is iffy. The room was really small, but OK since we didn't spend much time there. The beach is close and not very crowded when we were there. We got a quote on-line, but that didn't include the "resort fee" of $15 per day they tagged on at the end. Sort of sneaky - especially since there were no amenities they included.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but free wifi in the room and close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: BigAussie6
Reviews.Content: I was rushed and looking for some last minute accommodation close to the beach with free wifi in the room and this ended up being it. I stayed for 4 nights when Hurricane Felicia was around, lucky it fizzled out as I would not liked to have stayed inside all day. The rooms are small and had no fullsize bathtub. The bed was comfortable though. Although close to the beach, only a couple of rooms have an actual ocean view. The beach is only 50 to 100m away and it is a very nice section of beach. "Saretos on the beach" restaurant shares parking with the oceanfront inn and it is right on the beach but a bit out of my pricerange. For cheaper food options you need to be keen for a walk or have a car to get to the other shops and restaurants up South Kihei road (about a mile I think). I am not sure you would want to walk home from the restaurants up the road after dark though as the road is not well lit and borders along bush and parkland. Considering I paid the same to stay oceanfront with a view on Kaua'i, I think I could have done better if I had of booked somewhere else ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What We Wanted”
Reviews.Author: Gone2Alpine
Reviews.Content: Despite mixed reviews here, we loved the MOI. The rooms are small, but our was very clean and well maintained. We were literally a hundred steps from Keawakapu Beach. That made it easy to just go out an do a few laps on the boogie board at any time. The MOI has become a Days Inn property instead of Best Western and the management seems intent on making upgrades and keeping things looking great and keeping customers happy. The comparably priced hotel rooms at the Mana Kai next door paled in comparison. The condo units at the Mana Kai cost nearly twice as much. The two operative words for MOI are value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Comfort & Location”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler35
Reviews.Content: Great location, value and comfort. The new Days Inn Maui is the perfect place for the value conscious traveler. Located on one of Mauiâ€™s best beaches this Days Inn has clean comfortable rooms, friendly and accommodating staff and a fantastic location. You can literally roll out of bed and on to the beach. Sarento's on the beach, the Italian restaurant located on property rivals some of the best NYC Italian restaurants. If you're looking for somethig a little less formal the 5 Palms restaurant next door offers great breakfast and reasonable happy hour discounts. I would recommend this hotel to any traveler. Look for great deals on daysinn.com available for this site.
